name: profesia-sk-scraper
title: Profesia.sk Scraper
description: One-stop-shop for all data on Profesia.sk. Extract job offers, list of companies, professions, locations... Job offers include salary, textual info, company, and more.

input.title: Profesia.sk Scraper
input.description:
Configure the Profesia.sk Scraper.

NOTE: Either Dataset type or Start URLs must be given.

datasetType.title: Dataset type
datasetType.description:
Use this option if you want to scrape a whole dataset, not just specific URLs.

This option is ignored if Start URLs: are given

startUrls.title: Start URLs
startUrls.description:
Select specific URLs to scrape. This option takes precedence over Dataset type.

- If the URL is a listing page or a company page, all entries of that list are extracted.
- If the URL is a job offer page, only that page is extracted.
- If the URL corresponds to other Dataset type (e.g. list of partners), this kind of dataset is extracted.

jobOfferDetailed.title: Detailed
jobOfferDetailed.description:
If checked, the scraper will obtain more detailed info for job offers by visit the details page of each job offer.

If un-checked, only the data from the listing page is extracted.

For details, please refer to https://apify.com/jurooravec/profesia-sk-scraper#output
jobOfferDetailed.sectionDescription: These filters are applied ONLY when scraping job offers

jobOfferFilterQuery.title: Search keywords (full-text search)
jobOfferFilterQuery.description:
Comma-separated list of keywords. If given, only entries
      matching the keywords will be retrieved (full-text search)

jobOfferFilterMinSalaryValue.title: Min salary
jobOfferFilterMinSalaryValue.description: If set, only entries offering this much or more will be extracted

jobOfferFilterMinSalaryPeriod.title: Min salary per hour/month
jobOfferFilterMinSalaryPeriod.description: Choose if the minimum salary is in per hour or per month format

jobOfferFilterEmploymentType.title: Type of employment
jobOfferFilterEmploymentType.description: If set, only entries with this employment filter will be extracted

jobOfferFilterRemoteWorkType.title: Remote vs On-site
jobOfferFilterRemoteWorkType.description: If set, only entries with this type of remote work filter will be extracted

jobOfferFilterLastNDays.title: Last N days
jobOfferFilterLastNDays.description:
If set, only entries up to this much days old will be extracted.
    E.g. 7 = max 1 week old, 31 = max 1 month old, ...

jobOfferFilterMaxCount.title: Target number of results
jobOfferFilterMaxCount.description:
If set, only up to this number of entries will be extracted.
    The actual number of entries might be higher than this due to multiple pages
    being scraped at the same time.

jobOfferCountOnly.title: Count the matched job offers
jobOfferCountOnly.description:
If checked, no data is extracted. Instead, the count of matched
    job offers is printed in the log.
jobOfferCountOnly.groupDescription: Use these to verify that your custom startUrls are correct

proxy.title: Proxy configuration
proxy.description: Select proxies to be used by your crawler.

includePersonalData.title: Include personal data
includePersonalData.description:
By default, fields that are potential personal data are censored. Toggle this option on to get the un-uncensored values.

WARNING: Turn this on ONLY if you have consent, legal basis for using the data, or at your own risk. Learn more

outputDatasetIdOrName.title: Dataset ID or name
outputDatasetIdOrName.description: By default, data is written to Default dataset. Set this option if you want to write data to non-default dataset. Learn more

outputPickFields.title: Rename dataset fields
outputPickFields.description:
Select a subset of fields of an entry that will be pushed to the dataset.

If not set, all fields on an entry will be pushed to the dataset.

This is done before `outputRenameFields`.

Keys can be nested, e.g. `"someProp.value[0]"`. Nested path is resolved using Lodash.get().

outputRenameFields.title: Rename dataset fields
outputRenameFields.description:
Rename fields (columns) of the output data.

If not set, all fields will have their original names.

This is done after `outputPickFields`.

Keys can be nested, e.g. `"someProp.value[0]"`. Nested path is resolved using Lodash.get().

metamorphActorId.title: Metamorph actor ID - metamorph to another actor at the end
metamorphActorId.description:
Use this option if you want to run another actor with the same dataset after this actor has finished (AKA metamorph into another actor). Learn more

New actor is identified by its ID, e.g. "apify/web-scraper".

metamorphActorBuild.title: Metamorph actor build
metamorphActorBuild.description: Tag or number of the target actor build to metamorph into (e.g. 'beta' or '1.2.345')

metamorphActorInput.title: Metamorph actor input
metamorphActorInput.description: Input object passed to the follow-up (metamorph) actor. Learn more

maxRequestRetries.title: maxRequestRetries
maxRequestRetries.description: Indicates how many times the request is retried if BasicCrawlerOptions.requestHandler fails.
maxRequestRetries.sectionDescription: These options are applied directly to the Crawler. In majority of cases you don't need to change these. See https://crawlee.dev/api/basic-crawler/interface/BasicCrawlerOptions

maxRequestsPerMinute.title: maxRequestsPerMinute
maxRequestsPerMinute.description: The maximum number of requests per minute the crawler should run. We can pass any positive, non-zero integer.

maxRequestsPerCrawl.title: maxRequestsPerCrawl
maxRequestsPerCrawl.description:
Maximum number of pages that the crawler will open. The crawl will stop when this limit is reached.

NOTE: In cases of parallel crawling, the actual number of pages visited might be slightly higher than this value.

minConcurrency.title: minConcurrency
minConcurrency.description:
Sets the minimum concurrency (parallelism) for the crawl.

WARNING: If we set this value too high with respect to the available system memory and CPU, our crawler will run extremely slow or crash. If not sure, it's better to keep the default value and the concurrency will scale up automatically.

maxConcurrency.title: maxConcurrency
maxConcurrency.description: Sets the maximum concurrency (parallelism) for the crawl.

navigationTimeoutSecs.title: navigationTimeoutSecs
navigationTimeoutSecs.description: Timeout in which the HTTP request to the resource needs to finish, given in seconds.

requestHandlerTimeoutSecs.title: requestHandlerTimeoutSecs
requestHandlerTimeoutSecs.description: Timeout in which the function passed as BasicCrawlerOptions.requestHandler needs to finish, in seconds.

keepAlive.title: keepAlive
keepAlive.description: Allows to keep the crawler alive even if the RequestQueue gets empty. With keepAlive: true the crawler will keep running, waiting for more requests to come.

ignoreSslErrors.title: ignoreSslErrors
ignoreSslErrors.description: If set to true, SSL certificate errors will be ignored.

additionalMimeTypes.title: additionalMimeTypes
additionalMimeTypes.description: An array of MIME types you want the crawler to load and process. By default, only text/html and application/xhtml+xml MIME types are supported.

suggestResponseEncoding.title: suggestResponseEncoding
suggestResponseEncoding.description: By default this crawler will extract correct encoding from the HTTP response headers. There are some websites which use invalid headers. Those are encoded using the UTF-8 encoding. If those sites actually use a different encoding, the response will be corrupted. You can use suggestResponseEncoding to fall back to a certain encoding, if you know that your target website uses it. To force a certain encoding, disregarding the response headers, use forceResponseEncoding.

forceResponseEncoding.title: forceResponseEncoding
forceResponseEncoding.description: By default this crawler will extract correct encoding from the HTTP response headers. Use forceResponseEncoding to force a certain encoding, disregarding the response headers. To only provide a default for missing encodings, use suggestResponseEncoding.

logLevel.title: Log Level
logLevel.description: Select how detailed should be the logging.
logLevel.sectionDescription: Configure how to handle errors or what should be displayed in the log console.

errorReportingDatasetId.title: Error reporting dataset ID
errorReportingDatasetId.description:
Apify dataset ID or name to which errors should be captured.

Default: `'REPORTING'`.

errorSendToSentry.title: Send errors to Sentry
errorSendToSentry.description:
Whether to send actor error reports to Sentry.

This info is used by the author of this actor to identify broken integrations, and track down and fix issues.
